SEARCH
Package de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller

Klasse InstallmentController

java.lang.Object
de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller.InstallmentController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/installments") public class InstallmentController extends Object
Controller class for managing operations related to installments associated with bank accounts. Provides endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting installments. Handles HTTP requests and interacts with the InstallmentService to perform operations on installments. Ensures that access control is enforced using AuthenticationService.

Endpoints available in this controller:

  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/installments - Retrieve a list of installments with optional filters.
  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/installments/{installmentID} - Retrieve a specific installment by its ID.
  • POST /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/installments - Add a new installment to a bank account.
  • DELETE /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID}/installments/{installmentID} - Remove a specific installment from a bank account.

Handles exceptions and returns appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages for various error conditions:

  • 400 Bad Request - When request parameters or body are invalid.
  • 403 Forbidden - When the user does not have the required permissions.
  • 404 Not Found - When the requested resource (user, bank account, or installment) is not found.
  • 409 Conflict - When there is a conflict, such as an existing installment with the same name.
Autor:
Richard Prax, Jakob Roch

  • Konstruktordetails

  • Methodendetails

    • findInstallments

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<?>> findInstallments(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestParam(required=false) String startDate, @RequestParam(required=false) String endDate, @RequestParam(required=false) String description, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves installments for a specific user and bank account with optional filters.
      Parameter:
      userID - the ID of the user whose installments are to be retrieved
      bankAccountID - the ID of the bank account to filter installments for
      startDate - optional start date of the period to filter installments (inclusive), in the format yyyy-MM-dd
      endDate - optional end date of the period to filter installments (inclusive), in the format yyyy-MM-dd
      description - optional substring to filter installments by their description
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the list of filtered installments, or an appropriate error status if an exception occurs

    • findInstallmentByID

      @GetMapping("/{installmentID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findInstallmentByID(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @PathVariable int installmentID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves a specific installment associated with the specified user, bank account, and installment ID.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user
      bankAccountID - the unique identifier of the bank account
      installmentID - the unique identifier of the installment
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the installment if found, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the user, bank account, or installment is not found

    • addInstallmentToBankAccount

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addInstallmentToBankAccount(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestBody NewInstallmentDTO newInstallmentDTO, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Adds an installment to a specific bank account associated with the specified user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user
      bankAccountID - the unique identifier of the bank account to which the installment will be added
      newInstallmentDTO - the installment to be added
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the created installment if successful, or ResponseEntity with status code 400 (Bad Request) if the user input is invalid, or a ResponseEntity with status code 403 (Forbidden) when the request is made by a not authenticated user, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the user, bank account, or installment is not found, or ResponseEntity with status code 409 (Conflict) if there is already an active installment with this name.

    • removeInstallmentFromBankAccount

      @DeleteMapping("/{installmentID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> removeInstallmentFromBankAccount(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @PathVariable int installmentID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Removes an installment from a specific bank account associated with the specified user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user
      bankAccountID - the unique identifier of the bank account from which the installment will be removed
      installmentID - the unique identifier of the installment to be removed
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity with status code 204 (No Content) if successful, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the user, bank account, or installment is not found
